item.title: Tail vs. Body Recursion in Erlang Part 1
item.description: Erlang Map Function Link to heading The Erlang standard lib function lists:map is a higher order function which applies a function to each element of an input list to produce an output list. lists:map Specification map(Fun, List1) -> List2 Fun = fun((A) -> B) List1 = [A] List2 = [B] A = B = term() Implementing Map Function Link to heading If we tried to implement this function without using the standard lib, there’s a few ways we could do it.
